intro: Cudrania rumphii, commonly known as the African burr bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its fruit is a rough, spiky capsule that contains several seeds. Cudrania rumphii is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
